intro: Pilosella cymosa subsp. irregularis, commonly known as the irregular pilosella, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually hairy and arranged in a basal rosette, while the flowers consist of both ray and disk florets. It is often found in open habitats and is known for its delicate, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
